column2: An Ferocius Tiger from the jungles of lustria tamed by the Amazon warriors.

Stonehorns are massive beasts of muscle and violence, each several times the size of a Rhinox and - if it can be believed - several times as dense. Intelligence is of little import to these great beasts however, for each Stonehorn is quite literally a living fossil, its skeleton hardened by the same rock as the mountains where it makes its home.

the Mournfang. Aggressive predators that resemble a blend between the shaggy Rhinoxen and the ferocious Sabretusk, Mournfang packs are led by the largest of their kind and, working together, they can hunt and kill anything that lives in that harsh domain.

column1: ##prefixes   #add space after word here, Z for single, B for double

column2: \n§ZFair:§! Gives bonus prestige and vassal opinion to owner.[GetMountPrefixDesc2]
\n§ZRobust:§! Has a longer lifespan and less likely to lose health from random events.[GetMountPrefixDesc2]
\n§ZFertile:§! More likely to breed and can breed for a total of three times.[GetMountPrefixDesc2]
\n§ZPowerful:§! More effective in mounted close combat.[GetMountPrefixDesc2]
\n§ZSwift:§! More effective in speed based mounted combat.[GetMountPrefixDesc2]
\n§ZFair:§! Gives bonus prestige and vassal opinion to owner.
\n§ZRobust:§! Has a longer lifespan and less likely to lose health from random events.
\n§ZFertile:§! More likely to breed and can breed for a total of three times.
\n§ZPowerful:§! More effective in mounted close combat.
\n§ZSwift:§! More effective in speed based mounted combat.
A young horse not yet ready for riding.
A small pony ill-suited for battle, but desperate times call for desperate measures.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
The Dray Horse is a common pack animal used around the world.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
A generic work horse, accustomed to hours of labor and travel.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
A small and quick horse of Albionite origin ideal for skirmishing. Also responsible for being the foundation of many horse breeds.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
This horse is one of the most commonly used horses by the Estalians for their light cavalry forces.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
A horse primarily used by nobles to show off their wealth and influence to others.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
Coursers are light horses used primarily for light cavalry and hunting.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
Destriers are larger and stronger than Coursers, making them the ideal generic warhorse.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
These small horses are accustomed to the rugged terrain of their homeland, allowing them to easily outperform others in such terrain.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
This Destrier has adapted to the harsh climate of the Land of Chill, improving it's physical capabilities.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
A noble horse from the rich lands of Cathay, an impressive horse that gives rise to jealousy in others.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
A Destrier bred and raised for only one purpose, war.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
A Charger from the great lands of Cathay, both prestigious and deadly.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
A Courser born in the vast eastern Wastes. It boasts incredible speed and is mainly used by the nomadic hordes.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
One of the most prized horse breeds in the world. Arabyan horses possess speed, refinement, endurance, and strength.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
The Ellyrians of Ulthuan have trained their horses rigorously for the purpose of lightning fast raids.[GetMountPrefixDesc]

These horses were highly sought after in the old world. They are finely bred horses all the way from ulthuan, brought in as a trade commodity and further perfected by the Arabyan horse masters, but their numbers are slowly dwindling.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
The horse of the Tong Tribes of Eastern Wastes. With these horses in their possession, Wastes is no longer as imposing as it originally looked.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
The chaotic Hordes have come, heralded by the thundering of their horses' hooves. There can be no hope in this world, no hope at all.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
The Arabyan Charger is both beautiful and effective in war. This noble charger will turn heads wherever it goes.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
A Charger from lands of the Fair Bretonnia. This warhorse is as fearless as it is powerful, able to charge into the heaviest formations. [GetMountPrefixDesc]
The one humped Dromedary is an ideal companion for the scorching deserts of the Arabyan Peninsula.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
The two humped Aguidi Camel is mostly used as a pack animal on the western slopes of Aguidi mountain Road due to it's tolerance for drought and high altitudes[GetMountPrefixDesc]
A relatively small elephant yet still a terror on the battlefield.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
The large Southlander Elephant is extremely slow, but can inflict devastating casualties on it's enemies.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
A ferocious wolf found in the forests of old world, it takes a brave soul indeed to try subjugating one.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
This hardy bear has thick fur to ward off the harsh winters of the north.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
A skittish animal trained by the People of Athel Loren. It is more suited for skirmishing than close combat.[GetMountPrefixDesc]
This modifier scales with the amount of §ZFair§! mounts in the character's possession, up to a maximum of five.

The Mount Market is where you can access all mounts and their related equipment.
As [Root.GetBestName] is a Commander, perhaps it would be best if [Root.GetSheHe] has a personal mount to ride into battle.
Has NOT been already given a mount
You will choose what type of mount to bestow.
You can sell one of your mounts to the market.
The horses of §Y[Root.Offmap.GetFullName]§! are famed for their beauty and strength. You can request one of them for your personal use.
Since the §Y[offmap_cathay.GetFullName]§! is suffering from famine or plague, the horse's health is §Rreduced§!!
You will receive a §YHorse from Cathay§!!
The foal will take around 6 years to be rideable
One of your foals has grown up enough to ride.
Unfortunately none of the nearby Heartlands can supply you with a [mount_bought_item.GetName]. Your money has been refunded.
The upkeep cost of your mounts will now be deducted.\nIf you disable this notification, the upkeep will still be deducted yearly. You will be asked again when you switch characters.

You have arrived at the Mount Market, a place where many merchants and nobles gather in order to find the best horses and other rideable beasts in the land. There are many things to see here, thus you decide to start with...
From here you can find many types of horses. You may be able to buy camels and elephants if you can reach their home provinces. Other exotic beasts may also be available.
Get dat Gobo engineer git here, i want da chariot!
Wassa mean i need to choose what to do?
A mighty warlord needs a proppa mount!
There are many types of horses in the world. From the cheap Rouncey to the heaviest of warhorses.
There are many types of horses in the world. From the cheap Rouncey to the heaviest of warhorses.
§GDray Horses are generally used as pack animals§!
§GRounceys are generic work horses, they provice no combat bonuses but are better than walking§!
There are many types of horses in the world. From the cheap Rouncey to the heaviest of warhorses.
§GHobbys are light skirmishing horses which have a high chance of being fertile§!
§GThe Eestalin Jennet is a small light warhorse with a high chance of being fertile§!
§GPalfrys are mostly ceromonial horses that are popular with nobles§!
There are many types of horses in the world. From the cheap Rouncey to the heaviest of warhorses.
§GOriginally used as hunting horses, Coursers have become a common sight in the battlefield due to their speed§!
§GDestriers are generic warhorses, they are slower than Coursers but are more effective in close combat§!
§GThese horses are highly effective in rugged terrain, but are weaker everywhere else§!
There are many types of horses in the world. From the cheap Rouncey to the heaviest of warhorses.
§GChargers are Destriers specifically bred for war§!

§GCold ones are Rapacious Predators, fuelled by savage blood-lust that drives them to attack any warm-blooded creature that comes near. To get a Cold One, you must either find it while its young or Pay the Beastmasters for one§!
§GThis Destrier has adapted to the harsh climate of the Land of Chill, improving it's physical capabilities.[GetMountPrefixDesc]§!
There are many types of horses in the world. From the cheap Rouncey to the heaviest of warhorses.
§GThe Moors are famous for their swift cavalry, making their horses ideal for skirmishes§!
§GArabyan horses are light and suited to the harsh deserts in Araby, they also have a high chance of being fair§!
§GUnlike the Arabyan Courser, this horse is ideal for close combat and has a high chance of being fair§!
There are many types of horses in the world. From the cheap Rouncey to the heaviest of warhorses.
§GThe deadly Tong Hordes raid the lands of Cathay and Darklands regularly with the help of their swift and powerful horses§!
The Glorius Charger of the Chaos Wastes
§GThe mutated warhorses of the Wastes has proven more than a match for their southern cousins, being heavily favored by the Warlords across the wastes§!
§GThe Bretonnian Cavalry is one of the most powerful mounted forces in old World, their horses are meant to be in the middle of the battlefield§!
§GThese horses are decendants of imported horses from Ulthuan,and are made to be perfect for those who focus on offense instead of defense, they also have an increased chance of being fair§!
Camels are mostly found in the East, while elephants are found in both North and West Africa as well as in Ind.
Camels are mostly found in the East, while elephants are found in both Southland as well as in Ind.
§GArabyan Camels are well suited to traveling the harsh deserts of Araby, they are also quite fearless§!
§GCophic Camels are slow due to the rugged terrain around their homes, they are used mainly as pack animals§!
Camels are mostly found in the East, while elephants are found in both Southlands as well as in Ind.
§GWhile not as big as their Southlander cousins, these elephants are faster and are still a force to be reckoned with§!
§GThe large Southland Elephant is a slow but destructive weapon of war§!
§GTaming an arachnid as an worshipper of spider god should be of an breeze§!
§GForcin' a stupid squig to carry you to battle should  be an easy task albeit very demeanin' mount.§!
§GSubjugatin' a wolf would improve your combat abilities as well as inspire more gobos to follow you§!
§GSubjugatin' a boar would show da boyz whos tuff enough to lead 'em§!
An which kind of an saurian should i take?
Some wild beasts were never meant to be made into mounts, but who's to stop the strong and clever from trying?
§The Lammasu are a Manticore-like Chaos creatures with the body of a gigantic bull, a powerful mace-tipped tail and a massive, ugly head.§!
§GThe tigers of Ind are deadly hunters, able to easily ambush their prey in dense jungles§!
§GThese Griffons are accustomed to mountainous areas and known for their prowess, making them hard to tame or acquire.§!
Some wild beasts were never meant to be made into mounts, but who's to stop the strong and clever from trying?
§GThese large bears make their homes in the cold forests of the north, making the effects of winter negligible§!
§GThe Asrai are one of the few that practice Deer husbandry, these Deer are quite fast which makes them ideal for skirmish tactics§!

[Root.GetGovernorLetterGreeting]. [Root.GetChineseLetterBlessing].\n\nThe heavenly [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetLongChineseEmperorName], has graciously fulfilled your wish. A fine horse of Chinese origins will be bestowed upon you.
Since the §Y[offmap_cathay.GetFullName]§! is suffering from famine or plague, the horse's health is §Rreduced§!
Oh noble Incitatus, you are too good for these fools. Let us ride forth once more so that all may look upon us in awe!
Unfortunately none of the nearby Heartlands can supply you with a horse for [FromFrom.GetBestName]

You have decided to bestow upon [FromFrom.GetBestName] his own horse for battle. All that remains is choosing what type to give [FromFrom.GetHerHim]. Be mindful that should [FromFrom.GetBestName] die, become landed, or is no longer a Commander, the horse and equipment will be lost.
You can never go wrong with speed
A balanced approach will serve best
I want [FromFrom.GetHerHim] to always be in the thick of battle
Actually, maybe now is not the best time
During the Siege of [FromFrom.GetName] by [From.GetBestName] and [From.GetHerHis] men, the stables were hit by the falling rubble. Your [hurt_mount.GetName] was injured in the chaos.
During the chaos of battle, a stray arrow hits your [current_mount.GetMountType]'s side.

While you huddle in the safety of your castle, you remember the animals stuck in the stables. The epidemic will surely affect them if you do nothing. You could bring a couple of them inside the castle, but risk infection.
Get them here before they die!
Our lives are much more valuable
Recently there has been an influx of traders in [Root.GetName]. This has resulted in higher profits for the locals and thus to you, their liege.
Recently there has been an influx of traders in [Root.GetName] due to the presence of a trade post. This has resulted in higher profits for the locals and thus to you, their liege.

A group of craftsmen have arrived in your lands seeking fortune. They are quite skilled, especially in the creation of mount equipment but require some funds in order to get the tools they need. Sponsoring them would bring mutual benefits.

The current group of doctors from the Hospital of [From.GetName] have proven themselves extremely skilled and efficient. There are barely any sick patients left, allowing them to instead tend to the traders passing through the province.

The local traders have come to see you with an offer. If you would lend them some of your personal land for them to graze the horses, they would give you a small cut of their profits from their future sales.

As you look upon your lands, you think up of various methods to increase it's overall wealth. Since [Root.GetName] is considered a Mount Heartlands, perhaps you could take advantage of that. Nothing says fun like horse races. If you organized some you could draw more foreign traders to your lands.
It has come to your attention that you have run out of food for your [random_mount.GetName]. This could be a chance for you to improve your [random_mount.GetMountType]'s health.
Don't bother me with such trifles, anything is fine
Due to the rigorious training and care from [stable_master.GetBestName], one of your mounts has improved to a point where it has gained a new trait.
Always on the move, nomadic life is difficult but that is what makes true men. Your faithful [improved_horse.GetName] has gotten used to running long distances.
You've been blessed with a few hours of peace. As you stroll about your halls, you wonder if you should perhaps take one of your [random_mount.GetMountType]s on a ride, but where to?
A leisurely ride around my lands
